subhead: The resignation of his trusted aide and two of his ministers over corruption allegations has ignited debate over the Ukrainian president's leadership style, as calls grow for greater openness and transparency.

Suspected member of Louvre heist gang joins others in detention
subhead: Investigators say the 39-year-old man from the Paris suburb of Seine-Saint-Denis, who was arrested a week ago, was the fourth and final member of the masked gang that carried out the October 19 robbery on the world's most-visited museum. The stolen jewelry, worth an estimated $102 million, has not been recovered.

title: The war in Sudan: A tragic symptom of US powerlessness
subhead: Devastated by the clash between the regular army and the militia led by Mohamed Hamdan Dagalo, known as 'Hemedti,' Sudan has become a battleground for the competing interests of its powerful neighbors – precisely those on whom Donald Trump is relying to end the conflict.

title: Francis Ford Coppola auctions his watches after  'Megalopolis' disaster
subhead: The American filmmaker will auction off several collector's items by F.P. Journe, Patek Philippe and Breguet on December 6 and 7, in an attempt to offset the losses from the box-office failure of his latest film.

title: Leonardo DiCaprio and Paul Thomas Anderson: Two Hollywood stars in Paris after the battle
subhead: Absent during the European promotion of the film 'One Battle After Another,' the American actor and director reunited in France to talk about Hollywood and their 30-year friendship.

subhead: After the murder of Mehdi Kessaci, the brother of an activist against drug trafficking, Le Monde spoke with residents of housing projects, social workers, judges and police officers. They described a growing sense of powerlessness and danger.

title: When private anger turns into a social force
subhead: In France, anger is everywhere: in the public sphere, in the media and at the ballot box. The majority of French people under the age of 35 say they have experienced it. From private feelings to collective outcries, they search for ways to channel this emotion.

title: The art of being Oscar Wilde's grandson
subhead: As Ireland prepares to mark the 125th anniversary of Oscar Wilde's death, Merlin Holland, his only living descendant, works in France to protect the memory of a man who was long viewed as scandalous.
